meanings.definition: A series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order.
meanings.sent1: The school bell rings at the end of each day, marking the completion of the daily cycles.
meanings.sent2: The water cycle involves evaporation, condensation, and precipitation.
meanings.sent3: The cycles of the washing machine always seem to make my socks disappear!
meanings.sent4: Life is like a cycle, with each stage flowing into the next.
meanings.sent5: The cycles of the moon have fascinated astronomers for centuries.

meanings.sent1: She completed three cycles of exercises at the gym.
meanings.sent2: The bicycle shop offers a wide range of different cycles for sale.
meanings.sent3: The cycles of colors in the painting created a mesmerizing effect.
meanings.sent4: The cycles of the traffic lights helped regulate the flow of cars.
meanings.sent5: The cycles of the seasons bring changes in weather and nature.

meanings.definition: To move in or follow a cycle.
meanings.sent1: The washing machine cycles through its different modes to clean the clothes.
meanings.sent2: The Earth cycles around the sun, causing the change of seasons.
meanings.sent3: The bicycle cycles smoothly along the path in the park.
meanings.sent4: Time cycles endlessly, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The fan cycles on and off to maintain the room temperature.
